CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 8, 1958, page A1, reads: "Patrolman Honored - Roy Lloyd, 66-year-old retired Aliquippa policeman, who, 24 years ago, became that town's first uniformed Negro law enforcement officer, receives tokens of appreciation from Albert Thomas, president of Lodge 26 of the Fraternal Order of Police, as Mrs. Lloyd observes the festivities, together with (left to right) the Rev. W. D. Dockery, pastor of Emanuel AME Zion Church, Aliquippa; Martin O'Toole, past FOP state president and guest speaker; Patrolman Sam Stipanovich, banquet chairman, and Aliquippa Burgess James Bruno. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait including members of Lodge 26 Fraternal Order of Police, from left to right, Emmanuel A.M.E. Zion Rev. W. D. Dockery, Albert Thomas holding item, Martin O'Toole, Mrs. Lloyd, Sam Stipanovich, Roy Lloyd receiving item, and James Bruno, gathered for retirement party at the Ukrainian Club on Broadhead Road in Aliquippa, Pennsylvania, another version
